name: Provençal White Bean Dip
description: While in Napa recently, I found and loved a white bean dip at Thomas Keller's Bouchon in Yountville, which came served with pain epi. It was creamy, mild, and mellow, but not bland at all. And it had a distinct advantage over butter—I could slather on as much as I wanted without guilt.
recipeIngredient: 1 15-ounce can cannellini beans, drained and rinsed
The leaves of 1 stem of fresh rosemary
The leaves of 3 stems of fresh thyme

recipeInstructions.text: Add all the ingredients to a food processor and puree until smooth.
NOTE: To roast garlic, slice off the top quarter of the garlic, wrap in foil, and bake at 350 degrees F for 1 hour. Then, squeeze out all the flesh.
